page.title: 05RECREATION AND LEISURE
page.content: The block touches the border of two villages, Abinger Common and Coldharbour, where there is a selection of club activities available to all residents, and, where transport is difficult, owners of private cars usally arrange to help those without a car. Clubs include Mothers Union, Women's Institute, Rifle Club, Gardening Club and Leith Hill Preservation Society. A good deal of entertaining is done at home and there are theatres and concert halls in three local towns, as well as London with its amenities being within easy reach. About 20% of the residents enjoy horse-riding. There is trout fishing available in stocked ponds, but this is very expensive, though Friday Street pond can be fished for a
